pullRequest.title: DashPay: Add create/update profile support
pullRequest.bodyText:

How Has This Been Tested?

Checklist:

commit.message: Use 0.15-SNAPSHOT for dpp, dashpay, dapi-client

This allows loading an identity before the credit funding
transaction is found.

BlockchainState: Notification shows sync percentage

Check for identity before syncing chain.

catch profile fetching exception and fix getIdentityByPublicKey

Fix recovery of passphrase
Refactor DashPayProfile
Merge branch 'evonet-develop' of https://github.com/dashevo/dash-wallet into dpp-0.15

ReceiveInfoView: Use observer to get profile information

Fixes crash

MoreFragment: Show the user profile only if the user has registered on PlatformRepo.kt

This resolves a crash when accessing the More menu before registring a username
PlatformRepo: Modify blockchainIdentity creation depending user registration state
Merge branch 'evonet-develop' of https://github.com/dashevo/dash-wallet into chain-sync-phase-3a
Add create/update profile functionality to EditProfile and More

nodes.bodyText:
The purpose of this method is to support the updating the profile if it was changed on another device.
However, one the user starts typing, then the observer is removed.
Originally, I had the observer turned back on after the update operation was successful and finished, but then the observer is called with the previous values in the profile and then the screen would change all the text fields back to the previous values.  Though, if one goes back to the More screen, then he newly changed Display Name would show up.
For now, after editing, then the View is no longer live.  This may actually be a bad idea to have the view being live.  It is perhaps unlikely that a user would update their profile on two devices at the same time.
This observer seems to be called after a update operation is finished in the EditProfileActivity and the user returns to the More Screen.

commit.message: Simplify Worker and Operation
Further simplifications and error handling
Rename UpdateProfileRequestWorker to UpdateProfileWorker

nodes.bodyText: This is where I thought we could turn the observer back ON, but it the data loaded was old.

commit.message: Change method of not updating from the database when editing
Add space in the character count string
Make the observer "inline" since it is only used once
